name: randRange
description:
Generates a random integer between two specified numbers.
 Requests for random integers that are greater than 100,000,000
 result in non-random numbers, to prevent overflow during
 internal computations.

params.name: algorithm
params.description: CF7+ The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

links.title: A better RandRange
links.description: RandRange cannot handle large integers and you will encounter bugs when you try to use min or max values that are near the maximum and minimum integer sizes. This shows another way to generate a random int or long.

examples.title: Tag Example
examples.description: The following example calls the Randomize function to seed the random number generator and generates 10 random numbers.
examples.code: RandRange returned: #randRange(local.myInt, local.myInt2, "SHA1PRNG")#

examples.title: Tag Example
examples.code:
<cfscript> 
 bytes = []; 
 bytecount = 32; 
 arrayResize( bytes, byteCount ); 
 for (  i = 1 ; i <= byteCount ; i++ ) { 
  bytes[ i ] = randRange( -128, 127, "SHA1PRNG" ); 
         } 
 </cfscript> 
 <cfdump var="#bytes#" />
